snippet: If you just cannot find a certain text character in your Windows fonts — or want to make one of your own — you can use the built-in Private Character Editor or other font-creation tools to create it.
abstract: If you just cannot find a certain text character in your Windows fonts — or want to make one of your own — you can use the built-in Private Character Editor or other font-creation tools to create it.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Use the Windows Private Character Editor
